title: I'd rather face Leblanc, Kat, Fizz or Akali than Zed
body:
Before you go on reading, yes this is a rant thread

1. I simply CANNOT make a mana intensive mage work against Zed. 

2. Does his poke even cost energy? It does so much damage for a non-mana based poke.

3. Yes, he's a bad teamfighter, but GOD he's just so damn overbearing in lane.

5. I don't even have to start on how difficult it is to itemize against him.  lvl 1-6, if you stay under your tower to try to last hit as a mage, chances are you will be 40 cs behind until you get a {{item:3070}} or {{item:3114}}. And after that, you gotta start the Zhonyas rush. And if he is smart and buys a {{item:1033}} , god I ............. I'm an average player. 
I'm not Faker, I can't keep up the CS !!!!! 
I can't buy magic pen, armguard and a mana item all at once. I'm constantly building to counter his item choices.

6. And don't say ask for jungler's help. HE has a jungler too, and they WILL tower dive you, you poor (due to no cs), defenseless, worthless, fragile piece of mage. 



Bye and have a good day. I hope you don't meet a Zed and have yours ruined like mine.

:(

Edit : 
- Look, the problem is that he pushes you to tower and you can't push back.
Don't expect to get all your CS under tower. **Your minions are not going to cooperate for you to simply last hit under your tower. **

He will keep pushing and poking until there's a huge CS advantage. Even if your jungler intervenes it's a very dangerous game for low HP mages.

and actually, Annie's w and ult take longer to cast than people think.  with the average human's reaction time, you will get your w or ult off ~1/8-1/4 s after she tele's back.  imo, she needs 1 or both of a delay before she can re-tele and/or less time to tele back.

if lb dashing towards you is not enough for you to predict that "hey she's going to be here" then you should practice your reflexes, because it's really enough time. Even if lb ports back, she's usually stunned too anyways.
it takes her about .3 s to get to you and tele back.  anybody who can react fast enough in that time to do anything more than maybe send a target ability after her is a god.

Besides, you're saying that leblanc is in a 700 ish range and poking you with w without q'ing first, as q's give ample warning.

she doesn't have to q, and she can do both at basically the same time.  besides, she normally procs her q with her e.

and you say that normal reaction time is .25 s as if 0.05 s is enough time to do anything...

first off, her cast times are nonexistent, they're just the brief time it takes for them to hit the target, of which her e is the only one that isn't almost instant.  second, she only spends a ton of mana on her combo at the beginning of the game.  after that she doesn't have any significant mana problems.

and actually, reaction time would be the time it takes you to register that she is moving.

Why is it that AP laners never seem to know how to last hit with AAs? Seriously, you shouldn't be relying on abilities for wave clear until mid game when you start grouping up anyway.

Start flask or Cloth 5 if you need the sustain so badly (yes it is unheard of, but not taking Doran's on an AP does work). Also try getting boots and dodging his skillshot (if you really can't, then at least stand behind minions for the reduced damage).

Number one way to beat Zed that I've found is to take somebody who is able to last hit well without abilities (or with very few abilities), can avoid his harass (shield or heal, also dashes), and can bully him around. Against Zed, all you have to do is get past the mid game so that your ADC gets a Merc scimitar, you get Zhonya's, and your tanks beef up. Orianna is an excellent pick into Zed, because you can max your shield to avoid his harass and you passive allows you to last hit with comparable ease to some other mid laners. Ahri also has a very responsive AA, good sustain, and better team fighting. Kyle is good vs him because you only need E to Farm well, and can heal and go invulnerable if he all ins you. Viktor is my personal favorite against him, because he is a natural lane bully and whenever Zed tries to all-in, you just drop gravity field on you feet, stand still, and drop your burst on him. He'll get stunned and then usually your burst will 100-0 him unless he delays his damage to get a QSS. If Zed starts split pushing, force objectives and team fights ASAP, because Zed will not win a 1v5 base race no matter what. Also, if possible have your top layer pick Nasus, he can out split push Zed any day, has better team fighting, and can drastically reduce Zed's kill power with wither.

EDIT: Malzahar is also an excellent pick into Zed because you can wave clear very well and very mana efficiently with malefic visions. Additionally, if Zed all ins you just drop your void puddle at your feet and Ult him.

I'm sorry did you just tell us to last hit with autoattacks when zed spam wave clears practically for free, often poking with the same spell/s

You should never be spending more than one spell a wave really. Soften up all the creeps and then blow them all up at once with an AoE. If you don't get Blue buff regularly, Mana is a real resource that matters a lot, so spamming spells and going OOM is much worse than clearing slower with AAs. Watch pro players, they rarely try to clear waves with spells unless they have to (i.e. not using a spell would mean they miss the majority of the wave to tower). Learning to last hit with AAs as an AP mid lane is what helps you keep from permanently pushing the wave in, which makes it easier to gank Zed (slippery though he may be). In addition, pushing the wave back in on Zed is the worst thing you can do, it makes *you* vulnerable to ganks, and also makes it easier for him to all in you since you can't hide under tower when he dives. Furthermore, it does nothing to hinder Zed, because he can last hit under tower VERY easily. Being under you own tower is the safest option.

Another really good pick against Zed is Malzahar. Malefic visions allows you to wave clear safely and easily, for no mana cost (often refunding a lot more than you spent even). Additionally, if Zed dives you, drop your puddle under your feet where he will show up after his R finishes, and then ult him and watch him melt. Rush a RoA>Zhonya's and you're all set for the rest of the match.

>You should never be spending more than one spell a wave really. Soften up all the creeps and then blow them all up at once with an AoE.

What about when Zed spams the wave into your tower? Sure you can CS under tower with minimal mana spent but then you risk letting Zed roam. That leaves your only viable choice as pushing the wave back at him whist expending large sums of mana.
There is this thing called AAing a minion more than once. It pushes the wave just as hard as spamming spells on it until the mid game rolls around (when spells start clearing minions in 1 shot).
It's still not as fast as Zed Q-E-Passive hitting the wave, and you will be shoved into tower if he does that.

You act like Zed can reliably use all of his spells to waveclear and poke at the same time. If he uses spells to poke, you control the wave. If he uses spells to push you under tower then last hit under tower healthy. You'd have to be dumb as rocks to stand on top of the wave he is trying to clear so he accomplishes both with one rotation.

Thanks for providing advice and a reasonable discussion.

However, I do have to say that in my experience against Zeds (which is not necessarily extensive, but I think is a reasonable sample size) they have the ability to wave clear quickly enough that they can easily enough push you under turret or force you to use abilities to clear waves.  Since most mid laners are not particularly effective farmers under turret with auto attacks you are still forced to use abilities in this case if you want to reduce damage to the turret and get last hits.  Basically what the OP said in their edit.

Some of your counter picks will probably (I don't play them so I can't be sure) run into this problem, namely Ahri and Kayle (Orianna does have AP ratio autos, I never seem to have problems with Viktor versus Zed, Malzahar straight counters Zed).  I would expect Ahri to be forced into using multiple abilities to save cs from the turret and I don't think Kayle clears fast enough to keep the minions out of the turret without tanking them.

I agree with your split pushing advice, but Zed doesn't split push that much if he gets ahead.  In my experience he tries to lever that advantage into killing your carry as often as possible so teamfights turn into 5v4 (Zed probably used ult on the carry so he is weaker for the teamfight but he still has his AoE damage) and you can't take objectives very quickly (if that carry was an ADC, and not top lane fed Swain or something).  Basically he turns a large lane advantage into you not having your best damage dealer, winning teamfights before they start.

Yes, you can counter pick a Zed and you can have strategy around him, but he is still hard to deal with if he gets even a bit ahead.

PS: I don't think Wither is as effective against Zed as you think.  He only really needs one AA in a kill combo and can still zone your movement with his W (or just blink to you).

Kayle can last hit under tower with relative ease because of E's on-hit damage, and the AoE means it is hard to get shoved in anyway. Ahri can last hit pretty well because her AA is so responsive, but she also has low mana costs and can afford to use more spells than most mid laners vs a Zed. Wither is good against Zed in a 1v1 mostly, which is the context I meant it in (because he won't be bursting a Nasus with only 1 AA in his kill combo). In a team fight, yeah Zed will probably be able to get the kill on a squishy through Wither, but that is it's own thing.

Uhhhhh how does Vel not get crushed by Zed? You're 100% skillshot-reliant, his ult drops him BEHIND you so you can't even ult easily, and you're super squishy. Zed is one of Vel's hardest counters imo.

After he shadows and ults, he has to walk to dodge me, or dodge by running **away** from me. As long as I don't E or ult him before he uses these, I can burst him down easily and barrier his ult. 

All this assumes I even let him get close to me, as I can wave clear effectively from miles away, so if he shadows, I'm already moving out of range. Once his shadow disappears and is on cooldown, he has to ult to do anything about me, which will leave him a sitting duck toward my combo, which is also a disengage, which also halves softies health.

And if his shadow is anything but across the lane, he isn't getting away from my laser without {{summoner:4}}.
I mean, generally a smart Zed will ult in and save W to use as an escape, or a dodge for your ult.

But he'll have to use some other form of mobility to get that close to me. Even if he does get in range, I just wait to use my E and instead QW him, forcing him to either dodge, or take great amounts damage from my combo. Since he won't be able to react to my Q in time with him right in front of me, he'll have to use mobility to get back on me anyway since he'll be slowed.
